plot: Bart's friends start a boys rights activist group to protest Krusty's all-female reboot of Itchy and Scratchy. When they catch Bart enjoying it, they kick him out, so he joins Bossy Riot, a militant feminist gang of sixth-grade girls.

Bart and his friends make a vow not to watch the all girl Itchy and Scratchy show. When Bart watches the show, Lisa films his reaction and she posts it on the internet. Bart is soon ousted by his friends for watching the show and they turn against him. Bart soon meets a feminist group named Bossy Riot, consisting of Carmen, Piper, and Erica. Bart soon joins Bossy Riot in order to help them spread their cause even further. Lisa soon finds out about Bart's involvement with the feminist group. During the Krusty show, Bossy Riot threatens to burn the Itchy and Scratchy videos in a pool of nail polish remover. At the last minute, Lisa kicks the pool of nail polish remover in front of the male audience. Bossy Riot is impressed with Lisa for making the boys cry from the fumes of nail polish remover, they allow Lisa to join their group. Elsewhere, Bart discusses his involvement with Bossy Riot to his friends.—dawsonpersi
